title: Baseball preview, 2021: More of what you need to know heading into Opening Day
body: Haddon Heights junior Caden Bodine delivers a single during a recent scrimmage against Lenape.It’s been quite a while since a high school baseball game was played in New Jersey.You have to go back to the 2019 Group 4 state final, a 2-1 victory for Ridgewood over Eastern at Veterans Park in Hamilton (Mercer County), to find the last time a run was scored, a ball was hit, a pitch delivered to home plate.With the 2020 season canceled due to the coronavirus outbreak, players and coaches couldn’t wait to get back on the diamond this spring. Pitchers and catchers kicked things off on March 26, with full-team practices beginning on April 1. Opening Day is scheduled for Monday, April 19.As part of the NJ Advance Media baseball staff’s 2021 preview, take a look below for a comprehensive recap of what we’ve published and what’s on tap as the start of a much-anticipated season draws closer. You’ll find links to conference and position previews, other essentials and features - everything you need to know in preparation for what is expected to be a thrilling season from start to finish.Other essentialsNote to readers: if you purchase something through one of our affiliate links we may earn a commission.
